title: Typhoon Mangkhut
summary: Typhoon Mangkhut,[nb 1] known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ompong, was a very powerful and catastrophic tropical cyclone that caused extensive damage in Guam, the Philippines and South China in September 2018. It was the strongest typhoon to strike Luzon since Megi in 2010, and the strongest to make landfall anywhere in the Philippines since Haiyan in 2013 and Meranti in 2016.[2] Mangkhut was also the strongest typhoon to affect Hong Kong since Ellen in 1983.[3]
